tweets.text: We are continuing to work around the clock to monitor flood risk and warn communities, following heavy rainfall at the weekend. There are 21 Flood Warnings in force in Yorkshire - please check your local flood risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

New month, new adventure... really proud to be joining @EnvAgencyMids as Area Director for the West Midlands from today üòä 

A beautiful patch with amazing diversity of people, landscape, wildlife and opportunity. 

Hoping it won‚Äôt be too long before I can get out to see it... üòâ https://t.co/UHkO0QziTK
What action is being taken about this @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @GeorgeEustice_ ? Please can you confirm? @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @Telegraph @AngelaRayner https://t.co/iYMvpSef1U

tweets.text: As Madonna once rapped: ‚ÄòBeauty is where you find it‚Äô - glorious 30 mins of lunchtime walk along the River Nene near Earls Barton @nenescape @marina_white @LoisJAspinall - so good for the senses & more #fastflow #photographyeveryday #countypride https://t.co/o4xr0qWsyi

It was an honour lastnight to receive this 2020 #MayorsAwards on behalf of #TeamEA who worked so hard to warn, inform and protect the community and businesses of #Shrewsbury during the #floods earlier this year. #ThankYou @ShrewsburyTC @ball_helen @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YaRJ3LpRWq https://t.co/6jOPskdz6Z
Thank you Chris and congratulations to all our staff involved in this work which helps to protect #Shrewsbury #Flood https://t.co/gHIlDtxHhi

The natural flow split maintains flow along the old route building new features in the reduced energy channel. Gravels are also splaying out from the avulsion zone as natural river and floodplain processes are restored. 

@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/0mIJpT8sLk

Our final #FloodHeroes #MayorsAwards is presented to the local #Shrewsbury @EnvAgency the local Shrewsbury Team who without fuss set up our flood defences and monitor rising flood levels, provide support to local organisations, business and residents

@Feargal_Sharkey @wessexwater @EnvAgencySW @sascampaigns Yes of course! It is the River Frome running through Oldbury Court Estate in Bristol. I have looked and the most likely overflow that it came from is currently unmonitored.

There are still flood warnings and alerts out in North Yorks, inc. on River Ure, Swale, Nidd and Ouse following heavy rain. Levels are expected to rise in York over the next 36 hours. The Foss Barrier has been lowered to reduce flood risk to homes. https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/uqdzkdU8br

Don't underestimate the size of the European waste mafia which ships waste all over the üåé even in lockdown. Nowadays it's trucked out of UK to end up who knows where. 

In 2018/19 @EnvAgency¬†prevented 13,000 tonnes of waste destined for illegal export.

https://t.co/wsChuIjDzP

tweets.text:
Enhancement of the sediment build up at a frequent breach point on the beck has taken a few floods to instigate channel switching but this process is now well and truly underway with permanent flow over the floodplain 
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/qCSePtR8wg

Work to encourage channel avulsion on Swindale beck finally crosses tipping point. Recent floods have started an avulsion creating 5 hectares of anastomosing wetland. Minor intervention and patience have eventually paid off!
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/biaKE3rFDA

tweets.text: @CCWilmers @Caidh @stotfoldmill @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency We were told historically Ivel Springs were revered. A place steeped in myth with mystery. Medieval and Roman inhabitants knew it was precious. Too special to let the environmental vandalism destroy it. Hands off our groundwater.

Excellent AGM for 'https://t.co/D74Y6hsb3m' tonight with fascinating historic survey by Keith Fitzpatrick-Matthews @Caidh @IvelRev @stotfoldmill @AquiferChalk So much done in one year but still no flow in the Ivel. Pull your fingers out @EnvAgency and help our chalkstreams.

New flood warnings issued in York today (Tuesday) by @EnvAgencyYNE #yorknews
https://t.co/2AWIJh1Vgc https://t.co/WN1QDS1Qb9

Time for a night shift as @EnvAgencyNW duty manager. Thankfully much better picture than last night. Not currently expecting further #flood warnings / alerts. Worst of the üåß gone in the next couple of hrs. Info at https://t.co/vKsRlvVySm #floodaware https://t.co/1UlcPY4qUT

New flood warnings issued in York today (Tuesday) by @EnvAgencyYNE #yorknews
https://t.co/2AWIJh1Vgc https://t.co/WN1QDS1Qb9

News from upstream . #ripon BoroBridge Rd on the outskirts of the city closed as Ure floods. always a sign of a lot of water heading to #york. @EnvAgencyYNE have flood alert in force here atm.  Take care if travelling across #NorthYorkshire @theyorkmix news - R Skell earlier https://t.co/8GGWkel8nN

urls.title: Why HS2‚Äôs groundwater impacts are under scrutiny
urls.description: Until now, concerns over HS2‚Äôs impacts on wildlife and the broader environment have been largely focused on what will happen to sites of special scientific interest and ancient woodlands.

tweets.text: Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi

@ChilternsAONB @Chilternstreams @AffinityWater @thameswater @jake_rigg @EnvAgency @ChilternSociety @CherylGillan @BBOWT This has been the subject of considerable concern by Chilterns residents.....Environment Agency have ignored our concerns from the start and have colluded with Align/HS2.....they are actively working to destroy the aquifer & nobody is doing anything about it! https://t.co/hEdc8Z3X63

We have not seen a Flood Alert from the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE for the Upper River Ouse in York but expect Flood Warnings to be released soon for ‚ÄúRiver Ouse at York - Riverside Properties‚Äù and ‚ÄúRiver Ouse at York - St George‚Äôs Field and Queens Staith‚Äù. https://t.co/ugGdBUi77f
We currently have 13 Flood Warnings in force in the Yorkshire area. Check your local flood risk and prepare to take action if you are at risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #PrepareActSurvive #floodaware

If you live in #Collingham, #Wetherby, #ThorpeArch, #BostonSpa or #Linton, we‚Äôd like to hear about your experiences of #flooding to help shape plans to reduce #flood risk along the River #Wharfe. Give your views to @Leeds_Highways here: https://t.co/5dzl2qUtpo https://t.co/aiJ1WGCkRN
